books.title: A Confession
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: A brief meditation on depression, philosophy, religion, and the meaning of life.

books.title: The Mucker
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: A street tough undergoes a transformation as he navigates the dangerous worlds of Chicago’s slums, a South Pacific island, and the wilds of Mexico.

books.title: Passages from the Life of a Philosopher
books.author: Charles Babbage
books.summary: The eminent Victorian scientist and mathematician on his inventions, dreams and adventures.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: Peter and Wendy
books.author: J. M. Barrie
books.summary: A mischievous and cocky young boy, Peter Pan, takes Wendy and her brothers on adventures on a fantasy island consisting of mermaids, pirates, Native Americans, and fairies.

books.title: Something New
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Two young writers experience romance and adventure in Lord Emsworth’s Blandings Castle.

books.title: The Taming of the Shrew
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: An unmarriageable shrew receives a marriage proposal.

books.title: Khaled
books.author: F. Marion Crawford
books.summary: A powerful genie is condemned to live the life of a man, unless he can find true love.

books.title: Dodsworth
books.author: Sinclair Lewis
books.summary: A newly-retired businessman’s peaceful European trip falls apart as his wife chases high European society.

books.title: The King in Yellow
books.author: Robert W. Chambers
books.summary: Ten short stories of madness, hauntings, romance, and art.

books.title: A Personal Record
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: Conrad recounts his childhood in Poland, his sailing experiences, and the work on his debut novel.

books.title: Monsieur Lecoq
books.author: Émile Gaboriau
books.summary: Monsieur Lecoq’s first case in which he tries to determine the identity of a man in custody for three murders.

books.title: Journals
books.author: Alexander Mackenzie
books.summary: Explorer Alexander Mackenzie details his journeys to both the Arctic and Pacific Oceans in his personal journals.

books.title: The Everlasting Man
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: G. K. Chesterton takes us through the history of man, rebuking common secular views and presenting the case for the Catholic Church.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Taras Shevchenko
books.summary: A collection of Taras Shevchenko’s poetry.

books.title: Sartor Resartus
books.author: Thomas Carlyle
books.summary: The meta-fictional commentary on the life of “famous” German philosopher Diogenes Teufelsdröckh and his Philosophy of Clothes.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: H. Beam Piper
books.summary: A collection of science fiction stories by H. Beam Piper ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Lais
books.author: Marie de France
books.summary: A collection of twelfth-century medieval tales of chivalry and romance.

books.title: Siddhartha
books.author: Hermann Hesse
books.summary: A man embarks on a spiritual journey through India.

books.title: Roughing It
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain’s semiautobiographical account of his travel across the United States.
